derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (as a term in grammar): from Latin nominalis, from nomen, nomin- 'name'

entry.def: You use nominal to indicate that someone or something is supposed to have a particular identity or status, but in reality does not have it.

example.ex: As he was still not allowed to run a company, his wife became its nominal head...
example.tran: 因为他仍未获准经营公司，他妻子成了名义上的老板。

example.ex: I was brought up a nominal Christian.
example.tran: 我成长为名不副实的基督徒。

entry.tran: (价格或款项)微不足道的，象征性的
entry.def: A nominal price or sum of money is very small in comparison with the real cost or value of the thing that is being bought or sold.

example.ex: I am prepared to sell my shares at a nominal price...
example.tran: 我做好了以极低价格卖掉自己股份的准备。

example.ex: All the ferries carry bicycles free or for a nominal charge.
example.tran: 所有的渡船都免费或以极低的收费运载自行车。

entry.def: In economics, the nominal value, rate, or level of something is the one expressed in terms of current prices or figures, without taking into account general changes in prices that take place over time.

example.ex: Inflation would be lower and so nominal rates would be rather more attractive in real terms...
example.tran: 通货膨胀会更低，因此名义利率换算成实际利率会更具吸引力。

example.ex: In 1990 personal incomes grew a nominal 6.8 per cent.

means.word_mean: 1. relating to or constituting or bearing or giving a name;

sentences.sentence: "taxable males as revealed by the nominal rolls"

means.word_mean: 2. insignificantly small; a matter of form only (`tokenish' is informal);
3. pertaining to a noun or to a word group that functions as a noun;
4. being value in terms of specification on currency or stock certificates rather than purchasing power;
5. named; bearing the name of a specific person;

sentences.sentence: "the nominal (or titular) head of his party"

auth_sentence.content: In the laboratory he was paid only a nominal sum.

auth_sentence.res_content: In fact, maximum nominal income tax rates should be raised.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In fact, maximum nominal income tax rates should be raised.

auth_sentence.content: In a nominal way, the devil was used by lawyers.
auth_sentence.res_content: In a nominal way, the devil was used by lawyers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In a nominal way, the devil was used by lawyers.

stems_affixes.word_buile: cog同+nomin名称,名字+al……的→adj.同名的,同姓的
ig不+nomin名称,名字+ious……的→不好的名字→可耻的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 名义上的;[金额,租金]微不足道的
stems_affixes.word_buile: nomin名称,名字+al表形容词→adj.名义上的;[金额,租金]微不足道的
denominate[v.命名,取名]+ion表名词→n.命名,[长度,币值的]单位
ig不+nomin名称,名字+y状态→不好的名字→可耻
nomin名称,名字+ee被动的人→被提名的人
de给予+nomin名称,名字+ate表动词→给予名称
nomin名称,名字+ate表动词→v.提名,任命

means.word_mean: 名义上的, 有名无实的

sentences.en: The king was only the nominal head of the state.
sentences.cn: 国王只是这个国家名义上的元首。

sentences.en: The settler got the house at a nominal price.
sentences.cn: 移居者象征性地花点钱买下了这栋房子。

sentences.en: The charge of the box lunch was nominal.
